architects.name: Renzo Piano
architects.bio: An Italian Pritzker Prize-winning architect, Piano has been considered by many to be one of the most influential people in the arts and entertainment category.
architects.description: His style has been characterized by many as high-tech design

architects.name: Michael Graves
architects.bio: Graves is an American architect.  Identified as one of the New York five.  Graves is most noted for his commissions of public works. A representative of new urbanism and neo classical architecture

architects.name: Frank Lloyd Wright
architects.bio: Wright was an American architect, interior designer, writer, and educator, who designed more than 1,000 structures and completed 532
architects.description: Wright's style, described by himself, was to build structures that were in harmony with humanity and environment.

architects.name: Rem Koolhaus
architects.bio: Koolhaus  is a Dutch architect, architectural theorist, and urbanist.  He is also a professor in practice at Harvard where he teaches architecture and urban design.
architects.description: provactive and controversial architecture.  Contemporary urban designer.

architects.name: Phillip Johnson
architects.bio: A very influential American Architect.  he is most known for his postmodern work since the 1980's.  Some of his notable works include the Glass House and One Detroit Center.
architects.description: Postmodern with an emphasis on texture and color on the external sides of the buildings.

meeting.title: Culture Class: Art, Creativity, Urbanism, Part I
